title: Netflix’s Depp v Heard Documentary Examines How Social Media Took Over The Trial
description: The Netflix documentary examines Johnny Depp's defamation case against Amber Heard—and the online frenzy that grew around the trial.

title: A Pig’s Kidney Has Been Working in a Human Body for a Month, a Medical Milestone
description: A pig kidney has been processing urine in the body brain-dead human male for more than a month, a medical milestone.

title: The Backlash to Bradley Cooper’s Prosthetic Nose in Maestro Ignites an Ongoing Debate Over Jewish Representation
description: The actor and director's use of makeup to appear more like Leonard Bernstein has reignited a discussion about 'Jewface.'

title: Protesters March Through Miami to Object to Florida’s Black History Teaching Standards
description: The protesters who marched to the School Board of Miami-Dade County objected to new curriculum standards.

title: Exclusive: Ron DeSantis on Fatherhood, Parents’ Rights, and the 2024 Campaign
description: The Florida governor talks to TIME at the Iowa state fair

title: Reneé Rapp Took Over the Internet. Now She’s Coming for Pop Stardom
description: Reneé Rapp, known for 'Sex Lives of College Girls,' 'Mean Girls' on Broadway, and her masterful internet presence, is realizing her dream of pop stardom.

title: What’s Next in the Hunter Biden Investigation
description: Here’s what happens next in Hunter Biden’s legal woes after a plea deal fell apart.

title: Pennsylvania Study Suggests Links Between Fracking and Asthma, Lymphoma in Children
description: Pennsylvania researchers found children living close to natural gas wells were more likely to develop lymphoma.

title: It’s Not Time to Give Up on Shakespeare—Yet
description: "Is it Shakespeare or simply his era that offends," asks Farah Karim-Cooper.

title: The Inflation Reduction Act Took U.S. Climate Action Global. Here’s What Needs To Happen Next
description: America's ambitious climate policy turns one. Here's what needs to happen next, writes Gina McCarthy.

title: Clashes Between Rival Militias in Libya Leave 27 People Dead, Authorities Say
description: Authorities say residents were trapped and unable to escape the violence after clashes erupted late Monday in Tripoli.

title: Germany’s Cabinet to Loosen Rules on Cannabis Use and Sale
description: The German government's approval, expected Wednesday, would legalize possession and use of cannabis for recreational purposes.

title: North Korea Claims U.S. Soldier Travis King Ran There Because of ‘Racial Discrimination’
description: It was North Korea’s first official confirmation of detention of Pvt. Travis King, who had served in South Korea and sprinted into the North while on a civilian tour of a border village on July 18.

title: Two Trump Indictments For Trying to Overturn an Election. Two Very Different Strategies.
description: A close read of the indictments reveal diverging strategies in prosecuting Trump's efforts to cling to power after losing the 2020 election.
